title: Duterte to rogue cops: Prepare to move out
text:
Headlines ( Leaderboard Top ), pagematch: 1, sectionmatch: 1 Duterte to rogue cops: Prepare to move out   4:40pm   has rejected a plan by   to retrain erring policemen and insisted that those who committed wrongdoings should be suspended from service. File photo 
MANILA, Philippines — An angry President   faced over 200 erring policemen and asked them to prepare to move out. 
Duterte gave the erring cops from the National Capital Region Police Office (NCRPO) two weeks before they move out and get sent out to Basilan to be part of “Task Force South” while they are still young. He said there is a lack of police in conflict-stricken Basilan. 
“Kayong lahat [na] nandito, kasali kayo sa Task Force South. Padala ko kayo sa Basilan. Tumira kayo doon ng mga dalawang taon,” Duterte told the 228 erring police men presented to him at Malacañan. 
“Kung lumusot kayong buhay, balik kayo dito. Kung doon kayo mamatay sabihin ko sa pulis ‘wag na mag-gastos para dalhin pa kayo dito [at ilibing]… Prepare to move out,” he added. 
Duterte said the rogue cops will have an option if they want to resign instead of being deployed to Basilan. Philippine National Police (PNP) Director General Ronald “Bato” dela Rosa previously clarified that they will not be removed from service because they are only facing light offenses. 
Earlier, the PNP also announced that 387 policemen from the NCRPO have been sent to Camp Crame and will undergo “disciplinary retraining” in Subic as part of the effort to cleanse its ranks. However, Duterte disagreed with the retraining plan, saying it is of no use. Headlines   
“Doon (Basilan) ninyo ipakita mga kalokohan ninyo, ano ite-training ko sa inyo? Training ko utak ninyo,” Duterte said. 
The president reiterated his order to have these erring cops clear the portion of the Pasig River of thick water lilies that make it difficult for him to cross from Bahay Pangarap to Malacañan Palace while on board the tugboat. He also threatened them to drink water from the polluted river as retribution.
